newsitem.title: UK: Cadbury upbeat on outlook for full year.
newsitem.headline: Cadbury upbeat on outlook for full year.

text.p: Dominic Cadbury, the chairman of British confectionery and soft drinks company Cadbury-Schweppes, said he was positive about expectations for the group's full year performance.
"The outlook for the year as a whole is positive with further growth expected for both business streams," he said in a statement.

In the half year to June 15 the company reported a 12 percent rise in pretax profits to 231 million pounds ($360.6 million) on sales up 13.3 percent to 2.293 billion pounds. Analysts' forecasts for pretax profits ranged from 218 million to 232 million, after restructuring costs, up from 206 million last time.

The group reported trading profit of 198 million from its beverages business and 105 million from confectionery, with its American Dr Pepper/7UP business, acquired in January 1995 for $1.71 billion, providing most of the profits growth.

The group set aside 35 million pounds for the restructuring of its Schweppes France operation -- reflecting the decision to set up in partnership with San Benedetto, the Italian producer of mineral water and soft drinks -- to build a new plant and close down two existing older ones.

The company has reached agreement to sell its 51 percent stake in Coca-Cola & Schweppes Beverages for 622.5 million which will produce a substantial one-off gain in the full year and greatly reduce its debt. ($1=.6406 Pound)
